did.head: DESCRIPTIVE SUMMARY
did.unittitle: Cornell Eleven records and briefs, 1979-1984.
did.repository: Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library
did.abstract: Files relating to the sex discrimination case, including files of J. Anthony Gaenslen (attorney for the plaintiffs) and Jennie Farley.

bioghist.head: ORGANIZATIONAL HISTORY
bioghist.p: The case, brought by a group of women calling themselves the Cornell Eleven (Cornell 11) and including Donna Zahorik, Judith Long Laws, Jacqueline Livingston, Antonia Glasse, and Charlotte Farris, accused Cornell University of academic sex-biased evaluation procedures.

scopecontent.head: COLLECTION DESCRIPTION
scopecontent.p: Files relating to the sex discrimination case, including files of J. Anthony Gaenslen (attorney for the plaintiffs) and Jennie Farley.

Three volume typescript copy of briefs and trial records from a court case, Donna Zahorik, Judith Long Laws, Jacqueline Livingston, Antonia Glasse, and Charlotte Farris, Plaintiffs v. Cornell University, seeking that the action be maintained as a class action for "all women with academic appointments who are employed by Cornell University..." Also one Cornell Eleven t-shirt.

prefercite.head: Cite As:
prefercite.p: Cornell Eleven. Records and Briefs, #4197. Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library.

did.unittitle: Undescribed material
Court Papers, Plaintiffs’ opposition to defendant’s motion for summary judgment, working papers – memos, affidavits, exhibits.
Rajender v. University of Minnesota, No. 4-73-435 (D.Minn) 1980 – copy of the consent decree.
Settlement proposal – Draft of the settlement proposal, notes
Friends of the Cornell Eleven (support to the Cornell Eleven Case) – Pamphlets, correspondence, petitions, paper clippings, notes, drafts of statements.
Friends of the Cornell Eleven, gift appeal.
Memorandum of law in support of motion for class determination – notice of motion, motion.
List of names and those who suggested them by department or school. Documentation on academic women and sex discrimination.

Processing complaints; perspective on affirmative action – Copy of a report on processing complaints of discrimination on the basis of sex (1977) and study untitled A perspective on affirmative action (Ann S. Bedingfield, seminar in legal education, 1980)
Women faculty – articles, pamphlet.
Women faculty; psychological studies – Articles.
AAUW (American Association of University Women), publications and newspapers – report, gift appeal, newspapers.
Academic appraisal – articles, notes.
Faculty appointments in Cornell University – extracts from directories and reports, memos, notes, article.
“Sex discrimination by law: a study in judicial perspective” by John D. Johmston Jr. and Charles L. Knapp.
Appointments in Cornell University in 1979 – statistics.
Information about Louise Palmer Fortmann – note, CV, letter. Affirmative action statements about academic appointments in 1980 – statistics.
Discrimination, Articles: “Wage discrimination, Job Segregation, and Title VII of the Civil Rights Act of 1964” by Ruth G. Blumrosen; “Academic freedom and problem of proof” by Karl Boedecker.
Women faculty in Cornell university – notes, paper clippings, statistics.
Women at Cornell; Meetings of the Friends of the Cornell Eleven; sex discrimination – statistics, notes, minutes, article clippings, letters.
Strategies to prevent claims against universities on employment subjects – articles.
Sex discrimination’s legal aspects – articles, notes.
“The status of women at the city university of New York”, a report of the Chancellor’s advisory committee on the status of women at the city university of New York, 1972.
Digest of Education statistics.
Report of the Ad Hoc trustee Committee on the Status of Women at Cornell.

Review and recommendations concerning affirmative action in selected departments, colleges and divisions, Cornell University (report by the Task Force on implementation to the affirmative Action Advisory Board).
Promoting and achieving sex equity in vocational education, report of a project conducted by the National Center for Research in Vocational education).
Academic Appointees in Cornell University – 1 volume of statistics.
Exhibits to defendant Cornell University’s memorandum of points and authorities in opposition to plaintiff’s motion for class determination – draft version.
Cornell Eleven – papers clippings, articles.
Cornell Eleven’s case, documentation collected by Jennifer Farley – legal papers, correspondence, paper clippings, drafts of settlement proposals, statistics.
“A preliminary statement on judicially compelled disclosure in the nonrenewal of faculty appointments” – copy of the article.
Correspondence from Hogan & Hartson – Letters and inclosed documentation.
Plaintiffs’ supplemental opposition to defendant’s motion for summary judgment – draft.
Deposition of K. C. Parsons – draft.
Tracing salary cursus. – notes, statistics.
Questions to ask about trusts and their tax consequences – list of questions.
Letter of Irving Lazar to C. Farris explaining the reasons of his refusal to recommend her promotion.
Cornell University’s salary studies – letter, rosters, graphs and histograms (no. 1-90).
Nos. 1-4
No. 5
No. 27
No. 90

Articles and studies: extract from an article about discrimination; comment on manuscript evaluation procedure; “Impression on affirmative action in 1978: a report to the German Marshall Fund” by Sadie Roberts.
Defendant Cornell University’s supplemental memorandum of points and authorities in opposition to plaintiff’s motion for class determination.
Exhibit of academic staff from 1976-1980.
Charlotte Farris files – listings, correspondence, memos, statements, notes, publishing agreement, bills, evaluations, statements, affidavits.
Judith Long Laws files – listings, correspondence, memos, curriculum vitae, statement, notes, survey, evaluations, chronology, copies of court papers.
Antonia Glasse files – listings, correspondence, memos, guidelines, paper clipping, evaluations, statements, legal papers, curriculum vitae, articles.
Jacqueline Livingston file – listing, petition, correspondence, evaluations, notes, memos, meeting minutes, chronology, curriculum vitae.
Donna Zahorik files – listings, correspondence, memos, meeting minutes, legal papers, statements, curriculum vitae, notes, resolution, surveys, articles, evaluations,
Sex discrimination – articles.
Faculty women and faculty couples in Cornell University – Affidavit, statistics, memos, notes, correspondence, drafts of arguments.
Advance response to the first interrogatory set in “Plaintiff’s interrogatories Re: Plaintiffs’ response to defendant’s opposition to motion for class determination” – correspondence, questionnaires.
Cooke deposition – notes.
Plaintiff’s supplemental opposition to defendant’s motion for summary judgment, working file – draft.
Settlement, working file – notes, letter.
Fundraising, working file – notes, correspondence, listing, pamphlets, statements.
Title VII and sex discrimination – articles.
Cases involving institution of higher education being sued by women faculty – filing cards.
Information about faculty members and their salaries from 1976-1980 – filing cards.
Class correspondents of Cornell Alumni News – filing cards.
New appointees from 1973-1976 by level, sex, and inclusion in 1981-1982 staff directory – filing cards.
Faculty members by title from February, 1977 thru February 1981 – filing cards.
References of articles and cases – filing cards and box.
Men and women assistant professors at Ithaca Campus, Cornell University, as of Fall, 1971 – filing cards.
Assistant professors appointed in 1973-1974 – filing cards.
Assistant professors appointed in 1974-1975 – filing cards
Women considered for tenure turned down by a negative department vote in 1976-1977.
Names of people considered too early or gotten out of Fall 1981 Directory.
Mailing list.
List of associate or assistant professors and their departments.

Plaintiff’s memorandum of law in support of motion to reconsider court’s letter of August 12, 1983, and grant plaintiffs full rule 56(f) discovery or in the alternative to decide the motion for summary judgment – salary claims – on the papers already before the court – original version.
Plaintiffs’ opposition to defendant’s motion for summary judgment (salary claims) – copy of the court volume with a court stamp.
Working file for a meeting – note, letters, article clippings, documentation, settlement proposal.
Defendant Cornell University’s memorandum of points and authorities in opposition to plaintiffs’ motion for class determination – annotated copy of vol. 3.
Defendant Cornell University’s supplemental memorandum of points and authorities in opposition to plaintiffs’ motion for class determination.
Plaintiffs’ reply to defendant’s opposition to plaintiffs’ motion for class determination – copy of the vol. 6 of court papers including a court stamp and the form for a stipulation.
Settlement of the Cornell Eleven case in the press – clippings of newspapers.
Copy of the Cornell Chronicle, vol. 13, no. 18.
Plaintiffs’ replay to defendant’s opposition to plaintiffs’ motion for class determination – copy of an annotated draft.
Copy of the Communiqué, no. of June, 1981.
Resolving sex discrimination on campus: four perspectives. Ed. Jennie Farley.
Cornell Eleven case and sex discrimination, clippings of articles.
